Compute Code Saturation Metrics

Source: R/set_saturation.R
set_saturation.Rd

Calculates the proportion of media sources (media_titles) associated with each code, as a measure of saturation. This function builds on the output of create_code_summary(), and can accept either a tibble of code counts or the full list output (when plot = TRUE).

Usage

set_saturation(
  code_counts,
  total_media_titles = NULL,
  min_count = 1,
  min_prop_media_titles = NULL,
  output_type = c("tibble", "kable")
)

Arguments

code_counts

A tibble or list output from create_code_summary(). If a list is provided (e.g., when plot = TRUE), the $table element will be used.

total_media_titles

Optional numeric. The total number of media sources across which codes were applied. If NULL, the function uses the maximum n_media_titles value in the input.

min_count

Minimum excerpt count required for a code to be included. Defaults to 1.

min_prop_media_titles

Minimum proportion (0–1) of media titles in which a code appears for inclusion. Defaults to NULL.

output_type

Output format: "tibble" or "kable". Defaults to "tibble".

Value

A tibble (or knitr::kable) summarizing each code’s excerpt count and the proportion of media titles in which it appears.

Examples

library(dplyr)

df <- data.frame(
  media_title = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),
  code1 = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE),
  code2 = c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE)
)
attr(df$code1, "label") <- "Emotional Support"
attr(df$code2, "label") <- "Academic Support"

code_summary <- create_code_summary(df)
set_saturation(code_summary)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 3
#>   code              count prop_media_titles
#>   <chr>             <int>             <dbl>
#> 1 Emotional Support     3              1   
#> 2 Academic Support      2              0.67
